page.title: 01HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: The village of{Lartington}is 2.5 miles from{Barnard Castle}and lies in the valley of the{River Tees}.The one storied cottages with their tidy gardens give the village a feudal atmosphere as it is in the shadow of a large country manor,{Lartington Hall. Lartington was mentioned in the {Domesday Book}as Lertington.Lartington Hall was built in the reign of Charles 1 by the Maires family who were Roman Catholics. In nearby{Romaldkirk}church there is a tablet to one of the family who became Bishop of Cimno in 1767.The last descendant,a Catholic priest,died at Lartington,in 1897.The family changed its name to Witham in 1800 .The{Witham Hall}in Barnard Castle is a memorial to the family.In 1918 the Hall was sold to Norman Field.He and his wife Olive owned the property until 1973.
